properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 4:55AM PST until January 13 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...NEXT STORM SYSTEM MOVING IN TODAY...

.Our next weather system is moving in bringing heavy snow to the
mountains and valleys above 1500 ft. Breezy conditions, especially
on exposed ridges, will create areas of blowing snow which could
significantly reduce visibility. Plan on slippery road conditions
which will make travel difficult.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8
inches. Locally higher amounts expected under stronger snow
showers in the late afternoon and early evening.

* WHERE...Coeur d'Alene, Post Falls, Hayden, Worley, Moscow,
Plummer, Potlatch, and Genesee.

* WHEN...From 7 AM Sunday to 4 AM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions which will make
travel very difficult. Blowing and drifting snow is also
possible, mainly over the Idaho Palouse.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY
